net.gliblybits.bitsengine.gui

Class BitsScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.gui.BitsGuiComponent
      • net.gliblybits.bitsengine.gui.BitsScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BitsButtonListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BitsEngineScreen

    public abstract class BitsScreen
extends BitsGuiComponent
implements BitsButtonListener
    A BitsScreen is the heart of any app.
    Games always consists of different screen (e.g. title, options, etc.).
    So, this abstract class must be extended to create these game screens.

    A BitsScreen is like a Window. You may add other GUI components like BitsButtons
    to it. This base class will take care of rendering and updating these components
    after they have been registered.

    Since:
    0.1 - Streak
    Version:
    0.1 - Streak
    Author:
    Marc Wiedenhoeft - GliblyBits

        Returns the id of this BitsScreen.

      • onInit

        public abstract void onInit()
        This method will be called before this
        screen becomes visible.
        This is the right place to load screen specific
        resources.

      • onPause

        public abstract void onPause()
        This method will be called before the
        app is paused.
        This is the right place to pause BitsTimers.

      • onResume

        public abstract void onResume()
        This method will be called before the
        app is resumed.
        This is the right place to resume BitsTimers.

      • onFinish

        public abstract void onFinish()
        This method will be called before the
        app is destroyed.
        This is the right place to free loaded resources.

      • onBackButtonPressed

        public abstract void onBackButtonPressed()
        This method will be called, if the back button on
        the device has been pressed.
        This is the right place to handle screen switched or
        to finish the app.
